cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 45 miles ENE of Kingston, Jamaica
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to move northwest across eastern–central Cuba late Sunday-Monday, emerge into the Florida Straits and the eastern Gulf on Monday night, brush or move inland along the west coast of Florida Tuesday-Wednesday, then sweep northeastward along/near the U.S. southeast and Mid-Atlantic coastline before moving offshore New England Thursday night-Friday.

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch – Cayman Brac & Little Cayman, Cuban provinces of Matanzas-Mayabeque-Havana, Florida Keys from Craig Key westward to Dry Tortugas.
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning – Southern Haiti, Jamaica, and the Cuban provinces of Camagüey eastward to Cienfuegos.  Hurricane Watch – eastern and central Cuban provinces (Camagüey through Santiago de Cuba).
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Jamaica, Cuba, Cayman Islands, Florida Keys and west coast of Florida, then the coasts of Georgia, the Carolinas and the Mid-Atlantic including Chesapeake Bay to New England.
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (3%) of tropical-storm-force winds; most likely winds 15–25 kt with higher gusts Thursday evening–early Friday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for Baltimore Harbor and upper Chesapeake Bay given current track and intensity.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain possible late Thursday into Friday, which could produce periods of reduced visibility and localized ponding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated short-lived tornadoes in outer rainbands and temporary channel/river current reversals are possible, along with minor schedule disruptions to vessel traffic.
